page.title: 01Slinfold and Land to West
page.content: The area contains one small village with both council and private dwellings. People generally leave the village of emploument. The village also has a small caravn site and two small factories. Tupically for a small village the heart of slinfold contains a church, primary school, public house and small shop. The countryside around is mainly used for pasture although there are some arable farms. The woodland, about twenty five percent of the total block is deciduous. The many fields are still surrounded by hedgerows. The block also contains several footpaths and ridal ways including a disused railway line. There are two main "A" roads and several small roads.
